Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository TODOS¶

async src.repository.todos.create_contact(body: ContactSchema, db: AsyncSession)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database session

Returns:

The contact object that was created

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.todos.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.todos.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_contact function returns a contact object from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id to be retrieved

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

Returns:

A single contact or none if the contact is not found

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.todos.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: AsyncSession)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts from the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Set the maximum number of contacts to return

  • offset – int: Specify how many contacts to skip

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.todos.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdateSchema, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be updated

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Get the data from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes an email address and a database connection as arguments. It then uses the get_user_by_email function to retrieve the user object associated with that email address. The confirmed attribute of that user is set to True, and then the database is committed.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database connection

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The newly created user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_user_by_email function takes an email address and returns the user object associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A user object if the email exists in the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar url for a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user whose avatar url is to be updated

  • url – str | None: Specify that the url parameter can be either a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in a database session

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: AsyncSession)¶

The update_token function updates the user’s refresh token in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is being updated

  • token – str | None: Specify the type of the token parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent
